headline: Quick Cinnamon Rolls
description: This cinnamon roll recipe is quick to make without using yeast. With no proofing needed, it's perfect for a breakfast treat if you're short on time.

video.description: Just the thing for a sweet weekend morning when you want to add some deliciousness to your usual breakfast!
video.name: Quick Cinnamon Rolls

name: Quick Cinnamon Rolls
recipeIngredient: 2 cups all-purpose flour, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Brush a 9-inch square baking dish with 2 tablespoons of the melted butter.
To make the dough: Whisk flour, 2 tablespoons white sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl. Work 3 tablespoons softened butter into flour mixture using your hands.
Beat milk and egg together in another bowl; pour into flour-butter mixture and stir with a rubber spatula until a soft dough forms.
Turn dough out onto a well-floured work surface and roll dough into a 1/4-inch thick rectangle. Brush surface of dough with remaining 2 tablespoons melted butter.

To make the filling: Whisk 1/2 cup white sugar, brown sugar, and cinnamon together in a small bowl. Sprinkle 1/2 of the cinnamon sugar mixture in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle remaining cinnamon sugar over butter-brushed dough.
Roll dough around filling to form a log; cut log into 18 rolls and place rolls in the prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until rolls are set, 20 to 25 minutes.

To make the frosting: Beat confectioners' sugar, cream cheese, 1/4 cup softened butter, and vanilla extract together in a bowl until frosting is smooth. Top hot cinnamon rolls with cream cheese frosting.

review.reviewBody: This was very delicious but the crunch of the brown sugar mixture was throwing it off. Great recipe but could use some tweaks
This recipe is good. My young daughter and made this when we were snowed in during a blizzard. I am not a baker by any means, so I thought this recipe was fairly simple.

I would cut back on the sugar, probably by half, and a half recipe of the frosting would be sufficient, then put some cinnamon in the dough. They did have more the texture and taste of a biscuit, but I liked that they were easy to make. I didn't have to add extra flour, but it would probably make handling the dough easier. (And yes, the sink is full of dishes) Overrall we liked them but not sure the recipe is a keeper.

Wow, got scared after reading reviews Went ahead anyway. Used half a cup of milk instead as people talked about stickiness. GREAT.. so easy, easy to roll, and cleanup was quick. Very little flour is needed for rolling. Amazing outcome.

Used a bit more flour after combining all ingredients. My 5 year old rolled them with no problem. Like them better than Cinnabon honestly only problem is I can‚Äôt stop eating them. Used Pilsbury cream cheese icing.
Yummy ü§§

I should have read the reviews before baking, because everyone else seemed to have the same problem I did. These needed tons more flour in order to be rolled out. It was a huge mess trying to roll up the sticky dough, so the rolls looked pretty terrible, but they actually tasted pretty good.

I like my cinnamon rolls biscuit-y so this was perfect for me. The dough was a little sticky so added more flour as needed before turning out and during rolling. Only had a 9‚Äù pie dish and that worked fine. I don‚Äôt like cream cheese glaze so will eat as is. Pretty quick and easy to put together for a Saturday morning treat. Will make again.

IDK if I'd call these actual "cinnamon rolls" but they satisfied a craving for something sweet and cinnamony at 10pm at night. Like others said the dough was extremely sticky so either less milk or more flour. I put almost a cup of flour down on the counter and on the dough. I also had to coat with flour before even picking it up out of the bowl. I think they need way more baking powder because these came out very heavy and not "light" at all like you would expect cinnamon rolls to be. I baked them for 20 minutes in a gas oven and they were mostly crunchy on the outside. I should have checked them at 16 minutes and taken them out at 18 minutes max. I think 25 minutes they'd be rocks all the way through. I am wondering if I did squish them all together in a pan if they would have been softer. I didn't have a 9x9 so I used a 9x12. I also only got 10 out of the roll out as I couldn't roll it out any thinner because the dough was getting stickier even tho I kept adding flour. I also sliced with a pizza cutter BEFORE rolling. There was no way I was rolling a 14" slab of sticky dough. Like I said.. these worked for satisfying a craving. It did take me 60 minutes from start to eating, not 40 like it says, but what's 20 minutes? I may make these again but with the few changes and they should be better.
didnt care for it but thats just me

These are pretty good. I've made cinnamon rolls the long way (with yeast) many times and today decided to try a shortcut. I added extra flour from the start after reading the reviews about sticky dough and they weren't kidding. Crazy sticky. Lots of extra flour in the recipe and on the surface and it was still extremely difficult to roll. They taste fine, but I think I'll go ahead and put in the extra time and do a yeast recipe next time

The dough was still too sticky to roll even after adding an extra cup of flour. I added a ton of flour during the rolling process and was able to get something that at least resembles cinnamon rolls. I doubled the recipe in a 9x13 pan and got 12 rolls out of this. Next time I'll spend the extra time using a yeast based recipe.
Super easy recipe with amazing results!!!!! Would definitely recommend

Much quicker than yeast type and I could not tell the difference. I did find a problem with sticking and so with my second batch I used parchment paper which I would recommend you line your baking pan with parchment paper, and you can spray with any spray oil or butter flavored oil you like, although I don't think that's necessary.
These were perfect I added a lil touch to mines an made my own glaze I didn't have cream cheese ....üòú No yeast no self rising flour nothing but all purpose flour....it was fluffy an SOOO soft

Easiest Cinnamon roll recipe I found so far and delicious! Recipe says no kneading but you do have to kneading more flour into dough so you can roll out without sticking. Will definitely make again üòÉ
A nightmare been baking for almost 30 years and made a mess out of my kitchen me and the rolls couldn't be saved in any form . Avoid this one at all costs , look for another one .
It was very easy to make and fast!

The recipe was too wet and it was hard to even handle putting the slices of cinnamon roll in the pan and they didn't taste like cinnamon rolls it was more of a like a coffee cake type thing but that's what you get when it's a quick recipe I wouldn't call them cinnamon rolls it's very misleading use a real recipe with yeast and take the time to do it right is how I feel

Great recipe!! All I can say for those that had trouble with sticky dough‚Ä¶..KNEAD, KNEAD, KNEAD THE DOUGH. You shouldn‚Äôt need anymore than MAYBE an additional 1/4 C flour. That should be on your board when kneading and slowly incorporating into ‚Äústicky‚Äù dough. Once incorporated, add a few tablespoons to board for rolling out. Work quick to begin rolling and you should have no issues with dough.

This is a great, simple recipe. Loved not having to wait for the dough to rise as you do with a yeast recipe. I cut mine a little bigger but other than that I followed the recipe as written. I'll definitely make them again!

Great base recipe for fast, yummy cinnamon rolls! I followed the recipe except for these changes suggested by other reviewers: Use 1/2 tsp salt (not 1 tsp) Use 1/2 c. milk or almond milk (not 3/4 c.) Add 1/4 c. filling mix into the batter I also used unflavored dental floss to cut the rolls before baking, and cut into 14 rolls (not 18). Top with frosting while hot. My family loved these!
This was so easy and everyone loved it!!

Dough was VERY hard to work with. FAR too much glaze makes them too sweet. I'm going to try again with more flour & colder butter. I also like adding the butter to the cinnamon-sugar idea for softer texture.
Very dry and I definitely used enough butter. Dough was difficult to roll into a log and cut. Don't even resemble cinnamon rolls.

I also did have to add more flour, about a cup until it was not sticky, just enough so I could roll it. Reading everyone elses reviews about adding more flour, I thought maybe it depends on the size if the egg, so I used the smallest one I had. The cinnamon rolls did not rise much after being baked, and you could still see my cut marks. It was like eating a day old cinnamon roll that was left out and reheated, kinda hard like a pizza crust. Taste was good. Next time I'll try a different recipe.

I really love this recipe ! No waiting for dough to rise. I've Been a baker for many years and I do agree the dough is to sticky to roll you have to gentley add a little flour at a time just enough to roll out, that said my cinnamon rolls came out perfect. And I am very happy with this recipe!
Add a little more flour and meat until it wasn't sticky before I rolled it out and use the flower I'm rolling pin and some wax paper and didn't have any problem whatsoever turned out great

I was kind of hesitant to make these but they turned out very tasty! I added about half a cup extra flour, halved the milk and added a teaspoon of cinnamon to the dough and it turned out perfect! Only thing is it did not make 18 (only made 6) and i forgot to add butter to the dough before adding the cinnamon-sugar so it all was falling out. The cinnamon sugar mix was also very sweet but maybe thats because I'm Italian and not used to too much sugar in things. Overall, it was a great recipe and so easy to make since I'm only 14. I just think maybe you should adjust the milk and flour or it will be too wet.

This recipe is so easy! I added a little bit of cinnamon & sugar to the dough as suggested by others. I didn‚Äôt have any cream cheese so I made a glaze with powdered sugar, vanilla & milk & drizzled that over the rolls. I gave some to my next door neighbours who, along with my family & I just love them! Thank you for this recipe, I will definitely be making it again & have already added to my Favorites.
Well, I am not sure this quick dough is an ample shortcut for the the rise overnight bread. Mine didn't rise and so baked like a hard rock. Yikes.

made this for church function and everyone loved them. This is my go to for future events. I also cut the dough down the middle to make smaller bite size rolls. They were a hit and the star of the church breakfast.
Absolutely love this recipe, quick and super tasty üòã Only thing I did differently is add the remainder of the cinnamon mix in the counter to the frosting and made it slightly cinnamonny
It was very quick to put together, but buns didn't seem to rise very much
Really good and super easy to make
I loveeeeed this recipe! I made them for my mommy‚Äôs birthday and they came out ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!! I will definitely be using this recipe again‚ù§Ô∏è. Thank you again!!!
I loved it!! I was feeling horrible and wanted to stress bake something quick, easy, and sweet, and I loved it! It made me feel a lot better. Thank you!!!
No changes, easy recipe. Everyone loved it! I will definitely will make it again
I thought this recipe was very straight foreward;not complicated at all.... Chad

Gonna call this one "Spiral Cinnamon Biscuits". Made only half of the recipe. Ended up with a sticky dough too. Added 1/4 cup flour before turning out onto parchment paper. It's more of a fold instead of a roll bc it's so heavy it keeps going flat. Cut them into appropriate sizes and attempted to shape into cinnamon rolls. Ended up with soft cinnamon sugar biscuits.
it was ok, the dough was quite sticky and they don‚Äôt taste the best.

Made my own icing however next time I'll double the dough and half the sugar/brown sugar mix. Recipe said it would make 18 but I only managed 7 out of it lol. To be fair they were cut large. Add flour as needed when taking out of bowl to remove sticky feeling (1/2 tsp at a time)
I really like this recipe. I found them easy and quick to make. Very good.
I added more flour and still the dough was wet. Not a great recipe.
they were as hard as rock the next day with being covered and they tasted like bread. very disappointed
It was so Amazing So rich so good!!!!!! I love it SO much! continue the good work!!!
Very disappointing. Easy to make and quick so I should have lowered my expectations. More like overly sweet cinnamon biscuits. Will not make again.
makes awful cinnamon rolls. good teacakes tho

Some things are worth taking time to do, cinnamon rolls are one of those things. We were left with hard-as-rock cinnamon hockey pucks with two pans completely coated and crusted in melted sugar, luckily our dishwasher has a ‚Äúsoak and scour‚Äù setting. Look up a real recipe that uses yeast. The icing is delicious though.

The dough is very sticky, but flour on my parchment paper let me roll them out. I also kneaded in some extra flour before rolling out. The cook time was longer for me, but that was probably because I used a slightly smaller pan and they rose very high in the middle of the pan. I will make these again but, use a 1/4 cup of sugar as we can taste the baking powder. Gives them a biscuit flavor. All in all a fairly decent recipe with potential to be great, with slight adjustments.
Taste is good, but the dough was -way- too sticky and was as good as impossible to roll. 25 min was a bit too long for mine and they are a bit more like cookies.
Waaaaaay too dry! The log completely fell apart after cutting and didn't make rolls. We ended up with delicious, but, not very pretty monkey bread.

The dough needs a extra 1/2 C of flour to become a dough. Plus dough for dusting surfaces. Someone else's review said "the ammount of flour is right you just need to knead for 15min to develop the gluten" bruh it's supposed to be a no knead recipe. You missed the point.

The salt needs to be reduced to a pinch. Someone else's review mentioned it "tasting like playdough". This is why. The recipe ends up making a very salty base. 
For reference a entire cake ie a 4C flour recipe generally takes 1/4tsp of salt, this is a 2C flour recipe and it asked for a whole tsp of salt. So doing the maths, this recipe is 8x more salty than normal baking. I'm assuming anyone who didn't complain about a playdoughy/salty taste, must have just completely skipped the salt cause they were lazy, in this case it was a good call.

Calling it 18 rolls is ridiculously exaggerated. Making 12 rolls I was cutting 1cm high and 3cm wide (unbaked).
Tiny!!! Idk if it would be physically possible to cut a roll smaller than that.

And finally, it's a American recipe, so for anyone not living in the USA, you should automatically half the sugar, which I did, and it was still plenty sweet. I'd forego the sugar at the bottom of the pan, and just try get it all in the roll. The sugar at the bottom just solidified into a crust.
(as I was worried it would, but hey, always worth experimenting, my optimistic side hoped it could've gone like a selfsaucing pudding, except it just... didn't...)
These are delicious. However! If you double the recipe, DO NOT increase the bake time. They will dry out and taste like corn bread.

I read the reviews but i still thought i should give it a shot. The dough was extremely dry but ended up turning out alright however the glaze was like a paste. overall i'd look elsewhere for a recipe.
Did this for my foods class. Says it makes 18 but thats 18 very small ones. To be honest they weren't terrible, but they certainly werent good. they were very dense and unpleasant.
I think this is an amazing recipe I made it but put a little twist on it instead of vanilla extract I use almond extract taste so good

I made a half recipe for my wife and I to have for breakfast. I wanted a yeast-bread taste so I added some for flavor. They baked up pretty, and then I glazed with my own glaze using melted butter, whipping cream, vanilla, and confectioners sugar. I posted photos before and after glazing in my review.

I think these are delicious! I dont bake often, this is my first time making cinnamon rolls, and not only are they delicious, as confirmed by everyone who tried them, but they are easy enough for a first timer to make, and have them turn out perfect. 
Also, I did not find any issues with the dough being too sticky, for sure not so you'd use an entire bag of flourflourit still sticks. All in all, they are FABULOUS!

I added quite a bit extra flour and kept mixing with my hands until it was dry enough to use a rolling pin. Also when i made the cinnamon filling i added a small bit of melted butter and milk so it would be a paste, then spread it with a brush. I baked for 15 minutes on 180 fanbake. They turned out gorgeous, would really recommend this recipe for easy cinnamon rolls.

This was literally the best thing I ever made. But i made a few changes. I baked the rolls for 17 minutes and had to add a 1 and 1/4 cup of extra flour to the dough to prevent the stickiness. I also didn't have enough time for the frosting so I made a mixture of melted butter, powdered sugar and cinnamon and used a brush to put it on rolls after baking. It made them sweet and a bit softer
it only made 6 and very sticky dough I recommend more flour but overall very tasty!
Best quick & easy Cinnamon Roll recipe I've found yet, they turned out great & extremely flavorful/delicious! Will definitely be saving this recipe to make again in the future.
Great easy to follow recipe. I also added a ripe banana and got a great result best thing I ever made.
The cook time was perfect, but it was pretty dry and needed a glass of milk to go with it. Mine only made 12 cinnamon rolls, but they were decent size.

I started by following the recipe exactly. The dough was so sticky it was impossible to work with. I added flour to try to salvage it. So much flour that I'm not sure I'd even consider it the same recipe. Results were ok but not worth the frustration or the clean-up. My rolling pin may never be the same.

It actually turned out really well. It was easy to make and overall tasted really good, however next time I‚Äôll definitely be using less of the filling because there was just too much and maybe double the dough because the rolls didn‚Äôt seem thick enough.
this recipe said it was gonna make 18 cinnamon rolls but it only made 7! what a rip off. i was so excited to have a full tray of cinnamon rolls and what do i get not even half a tray
Makes 18, what a joke. Also the amount of dough and the rolling method do not work well together at all. For a sticky dough its easier to cut into strips then roll

This recipe needs to tweeted. 
For better results, I did the following:
- Instead of 3/4 milk, I used 2/3 milk and its Warm milk. 
- For the rolls to stay fluffy, I added instant yeast and let is rise for 30 mins. Later, Spread and add filling, rolled then let it rise for 30 mins more. 
- Bake at 350¬∞ for 15 to 20 mins
Great recipe my brothers and sister love them. I make these every weekend for them as a treat! Also the icing works great without the cream cheese (my brother hates it, as do I) 5 stars
This picture is after doubling the flower and it is still soup. Something is wrong with the recipe.

I made these last night for a family dinner dessert and these turned out SO GOOD! The texture was so soft, the flavor was rich and sweet and the frosting was to die for! I enjoyed making these and my family enjoyed them as well! Love the recipe! For sure doing these again soon! Love it!
What a mess this turned out to be. This mess however, turned into an amazing coffee cake. You see, there‚Äôs no way to roll that recipe so it all went into the sugared pan and viola.
I agree that this recipe needs more flour. Fortunately I read the comments before I made it. Otherwise, turned out great. Next time I will add a little more baking powder for more rise.

I am a hopeful baker in the sense that I pray that if I follow the recipes to exact it will work as I am not very good baking sweets. 

This recipes as in many other comments mention it is super sticky! That could not be more accurate. I had such a hard time trying to need the dough adding about a half cup if not full cup of flour didn‚Äôt measure just added a little at a time. This process took and extra 10-15 minutes between washing my hands and the cup used for additional sugar. Even after flouring the counter and rolling out the dough in the final step of rolling the cinnamon buns prior to cutting it started sticking again! I had re re flour the surface and almost back roll the dough so I could continue to roll it. Over all now easy and not quick they were still fairly white after baking for 25 minutes and it seemed a lot of the sugar came out the bottom and caramelized. The texture was cooked not fluffy but not overly dense either , had a little bit of a floury/doughy tase. They were OK but not great. I would probably not make this recipes again. Can‚Äôt upload picture from iPhone due to size requirements.

Take heed in negative reviews, as I did not. These turned out not at all like rolls and wasted quite a lot of time, despite the promise of being "quick".

The dough, as others mentioned, was initially too sticky and even when I added flour, did not come together well. The sugary filling tasted like just straight sugar, and the cream cheese frosting was not great.

Would not and will not make these again.
Amazing quarantine recipe
It's my first time to make a cinnamon roll. It is so delicious. But I know I messed some parts cause my roll is heavy and tender as much as I want a fluffy and light rolls.
It turned out great, I didn't have cream cheese so I used goat cheese the glaze was incredible. Didn't need to add extra flour etc. But I didn't sift the flour either. Yes will make again.
Dough formed nicely and were very yummy. I added some crushed pecans.
I guess what came out was edible but I tried to make this for the first time Christmas morning and it caused huge delays. The dough was so sticky, it was impossible to roll.

So tasty! Next time, I will cut the sugar sprinkled into the pan and onto the cinnamon rolls in half, as the frosting is plenty sweet. I used a liberal amount of flour on the surface and on the rolling pin, and they were delicious! Will make again and again.

I tried to make this twice. I added almost a whole cup of flour the second time to make less sticky so I could roll it out. I ended up wasting an hour and half of time. Half a bag of flour and most of my patience. Terrible
Nice and quick, however it tasted vaguely eggy. Our dough was not soupy (unlike some others) as we activated the gluten by kneading. 4 out of 5 stars!

These turned out good! I was short on all-purpose flour, so ended up using 1 2/3 all-purpose flour and 2/3 cup cake flour. The dough did not turn out sticky at all, and was easy to work with. Also, this was the second time I made this, and the first time the filling was too dry. So, after brushing the dough with butter and sprinkling the filling on, I drizzled 2 more tablespoons butter over the filling, and it came out great!
Im 13 and made these for a late breakfast and they were very easy to make and tasted delicious and the dough isnt sticky which is helpful

The dough was way too sticky needed to add more than 1 more cup to the recipe. A little frustrating to have to adjust when you think you have just enough ingredients. Had to go next door to Dear Old Granny to borrow a cup of flour! Luckily she shares.
Awesome cinnamon gooey! Perfect.

Perhaps because I adjusted down, using the adjust serving function, or I just don‚Äôt know how to prepare the dough but mine was pretty much a disaster- the dough wouldn‚Äôt roll into a log; kept falling apart- even as I used more flour on hands- finally made into logs - certainly not easy for a newbie and not cute pretty rolls. Definitely could just be cook error !

We followed the instructions to the T. The dough was beyond sticky - could not get it to roll out or into cinnamon rolls. It definitately does not make 18 cinnamon rolls - unless they are the size of a 1/2 dollar. Very disappointing way to start off Christmas morning.

This is your basic biscuit recipe, but the added egg makes the door too wet to work with. Reduce milk to 1/2 cup, that should work fine. I wanted a cinnamon roll with no yeast and I‚Äôll be trying this soon. Sounds delicious!

I don‚Äôt think the people giving this an awesome review are following the recipe the way it‚Äôs written. This is my second attempt to make this recipe work, and I again found a mess and these are basically cinnamon sugar biscuit clumps and it‚Äôs no where near 18, I got maybe 7 ‚Äúrolls‚Äù. Not worth the frustration.
Not recommending. The dough is sooooo sticky! Tried twice with my son. Used up a case of flour and no use! Just frustrating! Disappointing!

Good recipe in a pinch...tasty! But, they're not cinnamon rolls. More like cinnamon and sugar biscuits with a glaze.
I had to add more flour because the "dough" was way too wet to roll out. 
I would make this recipe again...but not if I truly wanted cinnamon rolls.
Dough was soooo sticky, like others have said it was more like a biscuit and it only made about 8 cinnamon rolls.

After reading the reviews, I made sure to add enough flour on top of the dough prior to rolling it out. It rolled out fine and rose significantly during baking. The rolls themselves were a little dry and were moderately fluffy despite not having yeast in the recipe. I would recommend this recipe for anyone craving quick cinnamon rolls. Enjoy and good luck!

I saw a lot of comments on the dough being really sticky and that they were unable to do anything with it, but I didn't face that problem at all. Just properly cover your surface with flour and maybe even the thing your rolling the dough out with. 
Other than that they were AMAZING and my family really liked them, I'm definitely going to be coming back to this recipe to make these again

The recipe is really good.
Only adjustment I would make is on the quantity of flour - for half the qty - I used 1.4 cups of flour . Best would be to start with the 1 cup and add the rest to make the dough manageable
